basics.name: Jeongyoon (Jenny) Lee
basics.label: Applied Scientist
basics.summary: Passionate about turning ideas into responsible, meaningful AI that makes a difference in people's everyday lives

work.name: Relativity
work.summary: Developing end-to-end Generative AI products for legal tech, focusing on model monitoring, evaluation, and multi-modal AI systems.
highlights: Developed end-to-end Generative AI product from project kick-off to model monitoring and control plans
Built schema-driven LLM evaluation pipeline using Pydantic
Implemented multi-stage validation testing environment using Python, Prefect, and Kubernetes
Delivered MVPs for early-stage multi-modal AI initiatives across US, UK, and EMEA clients

work.name: Relativity
work.summary: Built and deployed multi-modal AI system for e-discovery processes in production environment.
highlights: Built and deployed multi-modal AI system for early-access customers
Implemented GPT vision model pipeline using Databricks and Spark
Managed versioning and deployment using Docker containers with Prefect in Kubernetes

work.name: GLASER Lab, Department of Neurology, Feinberg School of Medicine
work.summary: Developed explainable ML/DL models for interpreting complex neural interconnectivity across multi-region brain activities.
highlights: Applied GRU, LSTM, and RNN for modeling brain circuit dynamics
Enhanced interpretability of neural connectivity through time-series forecasting

work.name: Samsung Electronics, America
work.summary: Optimized supply chain efficiency by managing logistic data and forecasting
highlights: Forecasted OTRQ/OTD data and tracked weekly RTF using Samsung ERP system
Calculated container allocation based on CPFR plan demand and predicted weekly demand
Developed Python automation for direct shipment management, reducing manual preprocessing time

work.name: Akai Kaeru LLC
work.summary: Performed end-to-end software testing and data pipeline development
highlights: Conducted Alpha Testing to identify bugs and enhance user experience
Built end-to-end data pipeline using Spotify API for popularity analysis and visualization

leadership & activities.organization: Korean American Scientists and Engineers Association (KSEA)
leadership & activities.summary: Supporting growth of regional Korean American Young Generation groups across the U.S. (~290 members)
highlights: Help organize events and guide new group formations
Coordinate communication between regional chapter leaders and national committee

leadership & activities.organization: Korean American Scientists and Engineers Association (KSEA)
leadership & activities.summary: Helped organize national conference (200+ attendees) focused on AI-empowered career growth and leadership development
highlights: Coordinated program planning and speaker outreach
Fostered collaboration between industry mentors and young professionals

leadership & activities.organization: Music and Medicine, Stony Brook University
leadership & activities.summary: Performed music for patients and residents at hospitals and nursing homes
Performed as vocalist and managed practice sessions for a music composition club in Seoul, South Korea
Served as vice chair under the international office to support exchange students from various countries
highlights: Helped exchange students adjust to Korean culture
Organized and held international events

courses: Knowledge Modeling Relationships with Causal Inference

education.area: Computer Science, Applied Mathematics and Statistics

certificates.name: DB Management to Use Big Data

projects.name: Red Teaming Attacks and Defending Attacks on LLMs
projects.summary: How can we evaluate and improve the safety and alignment of Large Language Models against adversarial attacks?
highlights: Investigated methods for enhancing AI alignment and reducing biases
Explored model harmfulness and balancing safety

projects.name: Image Classification: AI-Generated Versus Authentic
projects.summary: Can we effectively distinguish between AI-generated and authentic human faces using deep learning techniques?
highlights: PyTorch, Python, dlib, XceptionNet (CNN), UniversalFakeDetect (GAN)

projects.name: Amazon Product Predictor
projects.summary: Can we accurately predict product ratings solely based on the sentiment and content of customer reviews?
highlights: PyTorch, Python, HuggingFace Transformers, DistilBERT

projects.name: Correct Gait Recommender
projects.summary: Can smartphone sensors be used to analyze gait patterns and provide real-time ergonomic feedback?
highlights: JavaScript, TensorFlow, Firebase, Android Studio, DNN

projects.name: Covid Infection Prevalence Rate Predictor
projects.summary: How can we predict an individual's vulnerability to COVID-19 infection based on their movement and location history?
highlights: MySQL, TensorFlow, Python, Microsoft Access, Deep Neural Network

projects.name: Improvement of Economic Performance Indicators using Big Mac Index
projects.summary: Does the Big Mac Index accurately reflect market realities, and can we create a more robust economic indicator by combining it with other metrics?
highlights: Python, PCA Analysis, Correlation Analysis, Economic Indicators
